revised_title: Edward Vogel's Observations on Central African Meteorology and Astronomy
tldr: Dr. Edward Vogel shares his observations on meteorology, astronomy, and geophysics during his expedition to Central Africa. He discusses the weather, temperature, wind patterns, and natural phenomena such as whirlwinds, snow, and shooting stars. Vogel also mentions the lack of earthquakes in Fezzan and the effects of the climate on the local environment and infrastructure.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Meteorology and Climate
